questions.question: Which ancient civilization built the city of Petra?
questions.hint: It's an ancient city carved into the sandstone cliffs.
questions.explanation: The Nabataeans built the city of Petra in the 6th century BCE.

questions.question: What was the main crop grown in ancient Mesopotamia?
questions.hint: It was a staple crop in ancient Mesopotamia.
questions.explanation: Barley was the main crop grown in ancient Mesopotamia, used for food, beer, and animal feed.

questions.question: Who was the ancient Greek philosopher who taught that 'know thyself' was the most important maxim?
questions.hint: He's famous for his method of questioning.
questions.explanation: Socrates believed that 'know thyself' was the most important maxim, and he used his method of questioning to help people discover their own knowledge.

questions.question: What was the name of the ancient city that was the capital of the Inca Empire?
questions.hint: It's the highest capital city in the world.
questions.explanation: Cuzco was the capital of the Inca Empire, located in modern-day Peru.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization built the Great Library of Alexandria?
questions.hint: It was a famous center of learning.
questions.explanation: The Great Library of Alexandria was built by the Egyptians in the 3rd century BCE.

questions.question: What was the name of the treaty that ended World War I?
questions.explanation: The Treaty of Versailles was signed on June 28, 1919, and officially ended World War I.

questions.question: What was the name of the first permanent English settlement in North America?
questions.explanation: Jamestown was the first permanent English settlement in North America, established in 1607 in what is now Virginia.

questions.question: What was the name of the famous ship that sank in 1912?
questions.hint: It was on its maiden voyage.
questions.explanation: The RMS Titanic sank on April 14, 1912, after colliding with an iceberg during its maiden voyage.

questions.question: What was the name of the famous battle fought in 1066?
questions.hint: It was a decisive battle in English history.
questions.explanation: The Battle of Hastings was fought on October 14, 1066, and marked a significant turning point in English history.

questions.question: What was the name of the famous revolution that took place in 1789?
questions.hint: It was a major event in modern history.
questions.explanation: The French Revolution began on July 14, 1789, with the Storming of the Bastille and marked a significant turning point in modern history.

questions.question: Who was the ancient Greek philosopher who taught that 'the unexamined life is not worth living'?
questions.hint: He's famous for his method of questioning.
questions.explanation: Socrates believed that 'the unexamined life is not worth living' and used his method of questioning to help people discover their own knowledge.

questions.question: Who was the famous American president who led the country through the Great Depression and World War II?
questions.hint: He was the 32nd President of the United States.
questions.explanation: Franklin D. Roosevelt was the 32nd President of the United States, serving from 1933 to 1945 and leading the country through the Great Depression and World War II.

questions.question: Who was the famous British monarch who ruled England from 1558 to 1603?
questions.hint: She's famous for her reign of 45 years.
questions.explanation: Elizabeth I ruled England from 1558 to 1603, earning the nickname 'Good Queen Bess' for her long and successful reign.

questions.question: Who was the famous Russian revolutionary who led the Bolsheviks to power in 1917?
questions.hint: He's famous for his role in the Russian Revolution.
questions.explanation: Vladimir Lenin led the Bolsheviks to power in the Russian Revolution of 1917 and became the first leader of the Soviet Union.

questions.question: Who was the famous American inventor who developed the light bulb and the phonograph?
questions.explanation: Thomas Edison developed the light bulb and the phonograph, among many other inventions, and is considered one of the most prolific inventors in history.
